content.description: This is Tequila Sunrise but starts with one hand on the pinch and one on the half moon undercling, go into DMOTR
Start matched on the right hand of Tequila Sunset and go into the DMOR

Great movement but awfully low to the ground, though it is not like you want to be cutting your feet right and left on this thing. 

  From the jug undercling at the back of the cave. Make huge moves out the roof on good holds untill you get to another good undercling. From here cross left over to a very positive flake  then bring the right out to another edge a bit lower. move your feet around and reach out and up right to a pretty terrible sidepull with a tooth at the top, make sure to get a finger behind this tooth as it is the only good part of the hold. Walk your feet around to the right and fall into an undercling with your left. Get a good right dropknee and start bumping your right hand out edges eventually getting to the hueco that Big Iron starts in, you can use intermediates or just go all the way in one toss. Walk your right foot into the hueco and match, then drop your right foot down to a spike and you are ready to start Big Iron. Finish Big Iron to the step off onto the boulder to the right. 

  Most people blow it on Big Iron at least once as this problem is not about any one hard move but holding on for the duration. 

Location

  Crawl all the way to the back of the Martini Roof and find a big chalked jug undercling, start here.
content.protection: Pads and spotter for the finish.

content.description: Sit Start with an undercling hueco right of the finish to Baby Martini and Martini Roof.  Make a tricky move out of the undercling to an ok crimper, pull off of this and join into Martini Roof.  Finish as for Martini Roof by climbing onto the boulder at the finish.

climbs.name: Martini Roof AKA Left Martini, The Toastmaster

content.description: A classic Hueco roof problem.  Start sitting far back in the cave with a good undercling hueco.  Pull the hard initial moves crux, and move into roof enduro climbing on big holds.  Pull a few final hard when your tired moves and finish on the rock at the far end of the roof.  The leg breaking boulder towards the end is off, but with some toe hook beta you don't need to put you're feet above it.
content.location: Start in the far back leftside of the cave on a big undercling hueco.  Shares the start hold with "Right Martini"

content.description: This one move wonder may feel pretty easy if you are tall, but probably will feel about V9 for the average height climber.  The stretch is more from foot to hand than armspan so it shouldn't be impossible for T-Rex's.  Start underclinging the obvious Hueco and make one big move out to the oval hold on Baby Martini.  Get established on Baby Martini and finish for that.
content.location: Starts just right of Schadenfraud in an obvious shallow undercling Hueco.

content.description: Sit down start at the hueco in the back of the roof and climb on crimps that look pretty good, if only it wasn't so steep and the feet weren't so bad.
Start standing on a good right hand crimp and a bad left pinch. Pull on with difficulty and make the dyno to the good hueco and top out to the left on good crimps.
content.location: Outside the left side of the martini roof area. Crawl through the hole by the finish of baby martini.

content.description:
Start facing right with your hands in the left side of the hueco and get your right foot on a sharp spike. Reach right to a crimp right of the hueco then get your left foot up into the hueco, if you feel like a pretzl you are doing it right and you should impress your SO if they are present. Flip your left hand into a good pinch on th right side of the hueco, flag your right foot and make a long reach to a line of holds that get better the further they are away from the hueco. If youcan't reach the goodness, don't dispare because you will be sinking a heal toe in the hueco to match the line of holds and work your hands across till your left is in the far right good hold in the line. Now cut the feet and check the swing. Make a long reach again out right to a good flake and lock in another better heal toe cam in the line of holds, this one is almost scary it is so good, it feels as though if you peel your foot may stay. Reach up left to an edge just below the lip of the overhang and stand hard on your right foot to release the heal toe. Go right for another edge then over the lip slightly untill you can step off onto the boulder to the right. Be my guest and top out but the rock is terrible. 

Location

  As you enter the cave before you get to the true roof stuff, there is a head size hueco at or just above head height, the problem starts here.

Great roof problem. Start in the first good left facing hueco and make your way out the roof to a tricky section towards the end. The leg-breaking boulder towards the finish is off, although with some toe hooking beta you don't need to put your feet above this boulder. To finish, climb onto the small boulder, while this is a different finish, I found it pretty cool.
content.location: Start on the first good right-facing jug on Martini roof.

content.description: Shady and sheltered, it is possible to climb here even if it's raining.  Can get crowded.
